jobs_results.title: Network Security Consultant
jobs_results.description:
Responsible for delivering network services & Security solutions to large Enterprise customers.

Responsibilities:
•

Own the technical design from concept to implementation; responsible for design, configuration, testing and commissioning of solutions
•

Support key customers in Security products such as Firewalls, IPS, IDS (e.g. Palo Alto, Checkpoint, McAfee, Bluecoat, F5) products.
• Manage 1st level escalation issues during deployment.
•

Serve as trusted advisor for customers and identify business opportunities for the organisation.
•

Participate in the tendering process and present technical solutions as well as services to customers.
•

Stay abreast of technical issues, options and advancements within the internetworking industry.

Job Requirements:
•

Experience in technical implementation, consultancy or presales environment for Networking / Security projects
•

Certification in CCNP / CCDP preferred
•

Certification in CCIE an added advantage
•

Good knowledge in network... systems, communications interfaces protocols and diagnostic tools
•

Strong experience deploying security solutions such as Cisco ASA, FTD, Palo Alto, Checkpoint, Juniper, McAfee IDS/IPS, F5 and Other network security systems
•

Good knowledge of products related to Routing, Switching and Firewall

Interested applicants please send your resume to:

Jerry Tan Puay Kng

Email: jerry.tan@jac-recruitment.com

EA Licence No.: 90C3026

EA Personnel: R1104802

We regret that only shortlisted candidates will be contacted

jobs_results.title: Sr Pega Consultant
jobs_results.description:
Responsibilities
• Technical Leadership role helps to coordinate and facilitate the technical aspects of the solution.
• Works with all stakeholders to help ensure best possible design and solution.
• SSAs lead the technical team in understanding requirements, and use cases and developing technical specifications for the configuration team resources so they can easily configure the requirements for each individual use case.
• Hands-on design and configuration of all Pega components including flows, UI elements, the configuration of business rules and automated decisions, reports, correspondence and Pega interfaces (services and connectors).
• Responsible for the technical solution design, including adherence to Enterprise Class Structure (ECS), data model and application framework.
• SSAs architect the technical solution and lead the technical team in development activities.
• SSAs ensure adherence to the Pega Systems development guardrails as well as the original design principles.
•... SSAs when appropriate mentor and coach client Pega trained configuration and architecture resources
• SSAs continuously provide knowledge transfer to the customer.
• SSAs ensure compliance with coding standards, UI standards, and Corporate standards
• SSAs perform code reviews to ensure application quality
• SSAs review alert logs to ensure quality standards
• SSAs run pre-flight and PAL to ensure performance and quality

Requirements
• Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Technology or equivalent
• 3-10 years of progressive Pega experience
• 5 years experience working with Agile or Scaled Agile
• 4 years minimum consulting / technical development roles
• Hands-on development background
• Manufacturing domain knowledge required
• CRM implementation background - with Pega or other technologies
• Pega Systems Certifications:
• Certified Senior Systems Architect (CSSA) - Highly preferred
• Certified Systems Architect (CSA) - Required
• Certified Methodology Black Belt (CMBB) - Optional / Preferred
• Certified CPM Architect (CCA) - Optional / Preferred

jobs_results.title: Senior Consultant Climate Risk & Climate-related Financial Disclosure
jobs_results.description:
Senior Consultant Climate Risk & Climate-related Financial Disclosure

Apply now

Job DescriptionMott MacDonald’s Climate & Environment team in the International Development Unit delivers projects and programmes for governments, development banks and other international institutions as well as supporting our global business to embed climate change into everything we do. Our team is looking for a senior hire to manage our climate risk and TCFD work in the team and support the global practice network. 

The role will be both internally and externally facing, leading our internal programme to embed the TCFD recommendations across the business focus of the role will be international climate change programmes for clients such as FCDO, ADB, WB and European clients.
We are delivering both large international programmes as well as leading the thinking in some innovative projects and initiatives. 

Key elements of the role will include:
• Strengthening our relationship with key clients
•... Managing the internal TCFD reporting programme, including oversight of the climate change risk management process
• Engagement with Mott MacDonald Board of Directors and Board Committees
• TCFD service and value proposition development, including further development of digital tools and support to the rest of the business on TCFD service alignment
• Supporting the implementation of our Group commitments on climate change
• Technical support within the global climate change practice
• Winning work and preparing proposals
• Managing projects as well as clients and sub-consultants
• External engagement with international initiatives
• Though leadership and support to external campaigns
• Leading internal and external workshops
• Guiding junior team members and technically assuring their work
• You’d be part of a truly multidisciplinary team; working across the breadth of Mott MacDonald’s sectors, regions and practices.

Candidate SpecificationKey requirements for the role are:
• Fluent in in written and oral English - additional language capabilities will be appreciated
• A Master’s degree in Environmental Science, Climate Change, Development Studies, Economics or a related field
• Experience working in an international, multicultural and diverse environment, with collaborative approach and working across sectoral and regional boundaries
• Thorough understanding and experience of international climate change frameworks
• Experience working as a consultant or an in-house role responsible for identifying climate change risks and putting in place risk mitigation plans.
• Understanding of global climate change science and international decarbonisation scenarios as well as best practice approaches to risk assessment and quantification
• Experience working with a range of organisations from asset owners to financial institutions
• Good working knowledge of the TCFD and associated frameworks
• Experience having delivered transition and physical climate risk assessments for projects
• Strong international network across clients, partner organisations and business groups.
• Able to review complex documents, summaries and present the key issues in a clear and concise way
• Aptitude in identification, progression, delivery and success in tendering for new project opportunities
• Able to work within a team and motivate others to deliver to high standards
• Able to meet challenging budgets and timescales

Job Profile

One of the largest employee-owned companies in the world, Mott MacDonald is a multisector consultancy providing engineering, management, and development services on projects in 150 countries. With over 16,000 of the best people working on a diverse range of challenges, we’re helping our clients deliver sustainable infrastructure and development solutions. We have a collegiate and collaborative culture which values equality and diversity, and we take proactive steps to create an inclusive workplace.

Mott MacDonald demonstrates global leadership on climate change through both the projects that we deliver and the way we manage our business. We are proud to be the first engineering company in the world to be certified as carbon neutral for its global operations and we are the only company in the world to have global accreditation to PAS 2080 (the international standard for managing infrastructure carbon).
As part of our journey to achieve net-zero, the Science Based Targets initiative​ (SBTi) have also certified that our carbon emission targets are aligned with 1.5°C.  
We have also begun an ambitious programme to assess climate risks on all our projects and are working towards full implementation of the TCFD recommendations.
We are working with external partners and organisations to increase ambition and action on climate change and shape the direction of our industry.
See here for more information on our company commitments

Other InformationEquality, diversity and inclusion
We put equality, diversity and inclusion at the heart of our business, seeking to promote fair employment procedures and practices to ensure equal opportunities for all. We encourage individual expression in our workplace and are committed to creating an inclusive environment where everyone feels they have the opportunity to contribute.

Agile working
At Mott MacDonald, we believe it makes business sense for you and your manager to choose how you can work most effectively to meet your client, team and personal commitments. We embrace agility, flexibility and trust.

More about Mott MacDonald
We’re a global engineering, management and development consultancy.
Our purpose is to improve society by considering social outcomes in everything we do, relentlessly focusing on excellence and digital innovation, transforming our clients’ businesses, our communities and employee opportunities.
A fundamental part of this is respecting each person’s differences and striving to meet their needs.
Our values: progress, respect, integrity, drive, excellence

jobs_results.title: Search Solutions Consultant - Australia or Singapore
jobs_results.description:
Botify is a high growth SaaS company, powering the online presence of 500+ Enterprise clients, thanks to its team of 200 people, spread across four offices in the US and in Europe (and soon in Asia!). Botify is 27m$ series-B funded, and has garnered awards from all over the globe for its superior technology that powers more and more Enterprise clients everyday, thanks to a faster shift to online.

More than 5 million queries are made on search engines every minute, but more than 50% of pages on enterprise websites are not showing up at all in organic search results, a fantastic opportunity that Botify tackles.
Our unified, data-driven, and user-friendly platform provides superb ROI for our clients, making us the leader in Enterprise Search technology. The insights we deliver impact every stage of the search process, from the underlying technical requirements to content optimization, ranking, and real keywords, for clients across most industries such as e-commerce (Jet.com, Macy’s... Farfetch, Zalando….), marketplace (eBay, RetailMeNot, Monster), media (Axel Springer, Condé Nast, Refinery29), e-travel (Expedia, Luxury Retreats, Odigeo, Traveloka) or digital agencies (Merkle, iProspect, GroupM).

After successfully launching in Europe and in the US, we are excited to expand our operations in Asia-Pacific. The region will keep leading global growth in the years to come, and Botify is uniquely positioned to support the new generation of customer-facing giants.

We are looking for driven and purposeful professionals to join us, be a key part of the Botify Asia founding team, help leverage Botify’s great product, accelerate its expansion in the region and make an impact on the digital economy of Asia-Pacific.

Botify’s DNA
Unlocking Hidden Potential is at the core of our DNA. From helping clients realize their growth goals to providing personal & professional development growth opportunities for our employees, realizing potential is the fabric of who we are at Botify.

For our employees, unlocking hidden potential means an incredible investment by Botify in their personal and professional growth by offering individualized career coaching, a large professional development stipend, virtual mental & physical health programs, and annual Volunteer Time Off. You get all that other stuff, like snacks and happy hours, too!

We believe that a fulfilled employee is a happy employee so finding unique and impactful ways to give back to our employees, when they give so much to us, is at the heart of Botify’s culture and DNA.

Role Description
We are looking for a Search Solution Consultant, South East Asia / Australia and New Zealand, responsible for driving the overall SEO consulting practice at Botify for all of our clients in Asia-Pacific. You are the key specialist and expert in SEO, helping our clients to get the most of our platform and help them drive their SEO operations. A key member of the founding team in the region, you will help drive success for Botify clients in the country.

Are you a highly-organized, detail-oriented, analytically-minded, with a customer-first mentality? Have you mastered the art and science of using data to fuel SEO strategies ? If so, let’s talk!

As our new Search Solution Consultant, South East Asia / Australia and New Zealand, you will own the SEO consulting scope for the region. This includes:
• Foster adoption of the Botify Platform at most levels throughout customer organizations
• Work closely with customers to coordinate their work and set-up their project including every advanced setting offered by the platform
• Deliver dedicated trainings based on our customers’ data and industry (from basics to advanced, depending on customers’ involvement)
• Organize the Botify Certification Program inside our customers’ organization
• Engage with your customers to build Advanced Reports to answer business objectives, including use of API and import of third-party data, or on ad hoc SEO requests - helping them solve their problems and be impactful
• Build long-term, deep relationships at all levels within our customers’ organizations
• Provide feedback to our Product Team with feature requests and product enhancements
• Team up closely with our Client Partner Team to maintain exceptionally high levels of customer satisfaction
Your profile includes ideally:
• At least 7 years as an SEO consultant/expert with Enterprise customers, or as an in-house SEO Manager for a medium to large website, covering all aspects of SEO from high-level strategy down to technical SEO
• Very good understanding of search engines crawling behavior and impact on traffic and revenue
• Technical SEO Experience using web crawlers, log analyzers, and SEO tools
• Ability to read/understand HTML, detect a site is in Javascript, and write regular expressions, among other coding skills
• Proven project management experience within global organizations
• Demonstrated top-notch problem solving, analytical, and statistical skills
• Good interpersonal skills, with ability to work with both technical and business staff
• Comfortable with technical concepts and adept at learning new technology applications
• Exceptional verbal and written communication skills, with a keen eye for detail when building presentations
• Work Permit in Australia. Singapore: Preferably Singaporean/PR/PEPCulture & Perks
Unlocking every Botifyers’ hidden potential through our culture and values is critically important at Botify. You will be expected to be a contributing member to the culture at Botify, which revolves around these 4 values:

Learn Fast, Progress Faster.
Go the extra mile, it’s never crowded.
Work Hard. Stay Humble.
Be Bold. Be you.

On top of co-driving the success of a great SaaS venture in the fastest growing continent, you will be a part of a company who cares about your personal & professional development. To the end, Botify offers the following perks to help unlock your growth:

Individual Professional Career Coach for your personal development
High-end and design working environment, free snacks and drinks, mingling with other scaleups in your city
Flexible working hours, flexible work location
Three days per year may be used to help a charity of your choice for your personal development
Leverage the power of the Botify Platform to help the website of a charity of your choice
Global Botify get-together retreat, when it will be safe to do so
Personal Health Insurance
Competitive compensation package
Company sponsored training and mentoring
Company contribution to Fitness Centre subscription
Opportunities to travel to other offices in Europe, Singapore, Sydney and Tokyo
Monthly company dinners & drinks to celebrate success!

Botify is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, or gender identity

jobs_results.title: DevOps (Analyst - Consultant)
jobs_results.description:
About Accenture

Accenture is a global professional services company with leading capabilities in digital, cloud and security. Combining unmatched experience and specialized skills across more than 40 industries, we offer Strategy and Consulting, Interactive, Technology and Operations services—all powered by the world’s largest network of Advanced Technology and Intelligent Operations centres. Our 506,000 people deliver on the promise of technology and human ingenuity every day, serving clients in more than 120 countries. We embrace the power of change to create value and shared success for our clients, people, shareholders, partners and communities. Visit us at www.accenture.com.

Accenture Technology combines business and industry insights with innovative technology services to transform your business. Join one of the world’s largest independent providers of technology services to grow your expertise and help clients worldwide to innovate at scale and transform their businesses... Help change how the world works and lives through technology innovation.

Role: DevOps (Analyst – Consultant)

Role & Responsibilities:
• Build automation wherever possible to improve development team’s agility- never do the same thing twice. If you're using Bash, PowerShell, Python.
• Experience in setting up and using Agile continuous integration tools, for example:
• Continuous integration tool such as Azure DevOps, Github Action, Jenkins
• Configuration delivery tool such as Helm, Kubectl, Powershell DSC
• Experience in IaC (Infrastructure as a code) automation using Terraform preferred

With over three decades of experience in managing the systems and workings of global enterprises, we expertly steer our clients through their digital journey. We do it by enabling the enterprise with an AI-powered core that helps prioritize the execution of change. We also empower the business with agile digital at scale to deliver unprecedented levels of performance and customer delight. Our always-on learning agenda drives their continuous improvement through building and transferring digital skills, expertise, and ideas from our innovation ecosystem.Visit www.infosys.com to see how Infosys (NYSE: INFY) can help your enterprise navigate your next. Supporting in RFP/RFI response.· Handling Client discussions for due diligence, business information gathering etc.· Site Network Build & Transform· Migration· Support Hyper care and Handover· Writing solutions / estimates for RFPs.2. Essential: · Deployment· Cisco Switching NX-OS/Cisco Routing· VMware NSX-V/T· Network Automation/Python/Ansible· F5 /Citrix Load Balancing· Cisco Switching & Routing· As Built, LLD, Testing & Acceptance Testing Documentation Skills· Good communications skills in English - written and spokenb. Preferred · F5 Load Balancing, Network Security & Design Skills· VMware NSX-V/T· Certification: CCNP/CCDA equivalent, F5 Certified Technical Specialist· Team leading experience with a team size of 5-6 membersc. Additional Skills: · Experience in running operations with ITIL processes / Project Management - PMP· Excellent Analytical and troubleshooting skill.· Excellent in Verbal, written communication.· Creative thinking in implementing Service improvements (automation, incident reduction, etc.).· Willingness and flexibility to learn new technologies, scale up quickly and adapt to different roles as the situation demands.· Experienced in running operations following ITIL processes.· Experienced in writing RFPs solutions and presentations during client visitsInfosys is an equal opportunity employer and positively encourages applications from suitably qualified and eligible candidates regardless of gender or other attribute covered by equal opportunity legislation.Please note in order to protect the interest of all parties involved in the recruitment process, Infosys does not accept any unsolicited resumes from third party vendors. All recruitment activity must be coordinated through the Talent Acquisition department.All aspects of employment at Infosys are based on merit, competence and performance. We are committed to embracing diversity and creating an inclusive environment for all employees. Infosys is proud to be an equal opportunity employer

jobs_results.title: Cloud Consultant (certified Aws Architect)
jobs_results.via: via MNC Jobs Singapore | MNC Jobs In Singapore
jobs_results.description:
Responsibilities:

Participate in solution pre-sales, demonstration, presentation, POC and proposal preparation.

Understand customer’s requirements for security, connectivity, management & automation of their apps & workloads across a hybrid & multi-cloud environment.

Provide solution architecture, develop migration and deployment plans, and execute those plans for customers moving their on-premise or competitive cloud solution.

Design high-performance and highly-available, resilient application environments leveraging cloud technologies to meet customers and application requirements.

Execute POCs, where necessary, or supporting those done by customer.

Assist cloud engineering team to promote cloud and related service to potential customers.

Requirements:

Diploma / Degree in IT related fields.

Minimum 3 years of technical experience in one or more of the following areas: Cloud architecture design & implementation, DevOps, application design.

Prior working experience in client... solution proposing/architecting/pre-sales position.

Good understanding of cloud computing technologies.

Self-motivated person with good analytical, project management, communications, problem-solving skills, and able to work independently.

Strong practical Linux and Windows-based systems administration skills in a Cloud or virtualized environment.

Certified in public cloud platform (AWS, Azure, GCP, Alicloud) at professional level

Please submit resumes to john@oaktree.com.sg with the following details in MS Word format:
